Class Interaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • bio.singa.structure.parser.plip.Interaction
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HalogenBond, HydrogenBond, HydrophobicInteraction, MetalComplex, PiCation, PiStacking, SaltBridge, WaterBridge
    public abstract class Interaction
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Interaction​(int plipIdentifier, InteractionType interactionType)  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      abstract int getFirstSourceAtom()
      Returns the Atom ID of the source atom of the interaction, belonging to the protein.
      abstract int getFirstTargetAtom()
      Returns the Atom ID of the target atom of the interaction, belonging to the ligand.
      InteractionType getInteractionType()  
      double[] getLigandCoordinate()
      Returns the coordinates of the interacting ligand atom or interaction center in ligand.
      int getPlipIdentifier()
      Returns the PLIP-identifier of the interaction.
      double[] getProteinCoordinate()
      Returns the coordinates of the interacting protein atom or interaction center in protein.
      LeafIdentifier getSource()
      Returns the LeafIdentifier of the interaction source.
      LeafIdentifier getTarget()
      Returns the LeafIdentifier of the interaction target.
      void setLigandCoordinate​(double[] ligandCoordinate)  
      void setPlipIdentifier​(int plipIdentifier)  
      void setProteinCoordinate​(double[] proteinCoordinate)  
      void setSource​(LeafIdentifier source)  
      void setTarget​(LeafIdentifier target)

      • getFirstSourceAtom

        public abstract int getFirstSourceAtom()
        Returns the Atom ID of the source atom of the interaction, belonging to the protein. Pay attention to interaction type in question since definition may vary accordingly.
        Returns:
        The interaction's source atom ID.

      • getFirstTargetAtom

        public abstract int getFirstTargetAtom()
        Returns the Atom ID of the target atom of the interaction, belonging to the ligand. Pay attention to interaction type in question since definition may vary accordingly.
        Returns:
        The interaction's target atom ID.
